abstract: The latest automotive quality survey released on Wednesday by the research firm J. D. Power & Associates showed that consumers were reporting fewer overall problems with new vehicles.
snippet: The latest automotive quality survey released on Wednesday by the research firm J. D. Power & Associates showed that consumers were reporting fewer overall problems with new vehicles.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Carmakers are doing a better job than ever eliminating nagging problems like wind noise, paint chips and balky engines.

headline.main: Car Survey Shows Fewer Complaints but More With Personal Electronics
headline.print_headline: Car Survey Shows Fewer Complaints But More With Personal Electronics

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LEXUS DIVISION OF TOYOTA MOTOR SALES USA
